summary: Email chain among US Attorney's Office (USANYS) contractors and defense counsel regarding missing or mislabeled testifying witness materials (specifically 3521-003 and 3521-004) in the case US v. Maxwell. The exchange involves coordinating corrections and delivery of a supplemental 3500 production.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Defense counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell who emails the prosecution to inquire about missing witness material 3521-003.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Copied on the external email from defense counsel Laura Menninger regarding the missing witness materials.

connections.description: Both are legal professionals copied on the same email regarding missing witness materials in US v. Maxwell.

events.title: Inquiry about Missing Witness Materials
events.description: Defense counsel Laura Menninger emails the prosecution to note that material 3521-003 was not provided and requests confirmation or provision.

events.title: Coordination to Correct Production
events.description: US Attorney's Office contractors coordinate to re-stamp and replace incorrect versions of witness materials (3521-003 and 3521-004) on a thumb drive for delivery to chambers.

keyFacts: Defense counsel identified missing or mislabeled testifying witness material (3521-003) in the US v. Maxwell case.
Prosecution contractors acknowledged an error in labeling (produced as 3521-004 and 3521-005 instead of 3521-003 and 3521-004).
Corrected materials were prepared on a thumb drive as part of a supplemental 3500 production for delivery to chambers.
The email chain highlights procedural coordination between prosecution and defense regarding discovery materials close to trial.
